verses.text: O LORD, the God who avenges, O God who avenges, shine forth.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 94
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 94 The psalmist calls on the Lord as Judge to bring justice to arrogant evildoers, those who disobey Him.

verses.text: Rise up, O Judge of the earth; pay back to the proud what they deserve.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 94:2
rsbNotes.text: 94:2 Rise up, O judge. See notes 3:7 and 7:6; “God Is Light: Divine Holiness and Justice” at Lev. 11:44.

verses.text: How long will the wicked, O LORD, how long will the wicked be jubilant?

rsbNotes.title: Ps 94:3
rsbNotes.text: 94:3 how long. See note Ps. 6:3.

verses.text: They pour out arrogant words; all the evildoers are full of boasting.
They crush your people, O LORD; they oppress your inheritance.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 94:4
rsbNotes.text: 94:4 arrogant words. They should be ashamed and silent, but instead they shout their evil accomplishments from the rooftops.

verses.text: They slay the widow and the alien; they murder the fatherless.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 94:6
rsbNotes.text: 94:6 widow . . . sojourner . . . fatherless. See 9:18 note.

verses.text: They say, "The LORD does not see; the God of Jacob pays no heed."

rsbNotes.title: Ps 94:7
rsbNotes.text: 94:7 The Lord does not see. The wicked in their prosperity believe that God does not care what they do.

verses.text: Take heed, you senseless ones among the people; you fools, when will you become wise?
Does he who implanted the ear not hear? Does he who formed the eye not see?
Does he who disciplines nations not punish? Does he who teaches man lack knowledge?

rsbNotes.title: Ps 94:8
rsbNotes.text: 94:8 be wise. The wicked will be wise when they shed the illusion that God does not know their evil schemes, or that He is unable to do anything about them.

verses.text: The LORD knows the thoughts of man; he knows that they are futile.
Blessed is the man you discipline, O LORD, the man you teach from your law;

rsbNotes.title: Ps 94:11
rsbNotes.text: 94:11 knows the thoughts of man. The Lord knows even the secret thoughts hidden away in the heart (Ps. 90:8).

verses.text: you grant him relief from days of trouble, till a pit is dug for the wicked.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 94:13
rsbNotes.text: 94:13 until a pit is dug. The psalmist recognizes that there is often a delay between a wicked act and its punishment. The unrighteous may prosper for a time. However, that they will pay for their crimes is a certainty.

verses.text: For the LORD will not reject his people; he will never forsake his inheritance.
Judgment will again be founded on righteousness, and all the upright in heart will follow it.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 94:14
rsbNotes.text: 94:14 will not forsake his people. God may discipline the righteous (v. 12), to return them to conformity to His will, but He will never leave them.

verses.text: Who will rise up for me against the wicked? Who will take a stand for me against evildoers?
Unless the LORD had given me help, I would soon have dwelt in the silence of death.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 94:16
rsbNotes.text: 94:16 for me. The psalm takes on a personal note as the author prepares to mention how God delivered him.

verses.text: When I said, "My foot is slipping," your love, O LORD, supported me.
When anxiety was great within me, your consolation brought joy to my soul.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 94:18
rsbNotes.text: 94:18 your steadfast love. Specifically, God’s love for those in covenant with Him.

verses.text: Can a corrupt throne be allied with you- one that brings on misery by its decrees?
They band together against the righteous and condemn the innocent to death.
But the LORD has become my fortress, and my God the rock in whom I take refuge.
He will repay them for their sins and destroy them for their wickedness; the LORD our God will destroy them.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 94:20
rsbNotes.text: 94:20 wicked rulers. A king who perverts justice. A king of Israel was to reflect the kingship of God, particularly God’s justice and compassion. The psalmist refers to an Israelite king who did not seek the will of God. There are many such examples from the history of the divided kingdoms of Israel and Judah.
